| **Job Title** | Production Manager | **Department:** | Management |
| **Incumbent** | N/A | **Reports to:** | Operations Manager |
| **Date** |  |  |  |

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

* The Production Manager is a key leadership role responsible for overseeing daily production and warehousing activities at Kangopak. This role ensures operational excellence by maintaining high standards in quality, safety, and continuous improvement. The Production Manager will manage end-to-end production processes, uphold quality control, and lead a dedicated team.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Production Oversight**

* Manage daily production and warehousing activities.
* Schedule production based on customer requirements and efficient manufacturing methods.
* Oversee equipment maintenance.
  + Collaborate with the Operations Manager & Maintenance Technicians to report machine breakdowns and provide status updates on maintenance activities.
* Analyse production data for strategic improvement.
  + Generate production reports using MS Office as required.
* Identify and implement improvements in factory and warehouse efficiency.
* Manage shift schedules to balance skills and enhance productivity.
  + Oversee departmental projects related to maintenance and process optimisation
* Propose and oversee training initiatives to enhance staff skills across shifts.
* Integrate slitting with production to optimise warehouse operations.
* Standardise factory floor operations to ensure consistency.
* Address absenteeism by fostering a more flexible and efficient workforce.
* Actively participate in team meetings, sharing insights and progress updates.

**Quality & Compliance**

* Enforce quality control procedures.
* Ensure compliance with BRCGS standards to maintain product quality and efficiency.
* Act as Deputy for the BRCGS Compliance Officer when required.
* Uphold the requirements of the BRCGS Product Safety and Quality Management System.

**Team Leadership**

* Lead and develop Team Leaders.
* Recruit, train, and manage all operational staff.
  + Train new employees on machine operation per Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and BRCGS.
  + Conduct machine operation and safety training in accordance with occupational health and safety (OHS) requirements.
  + Provide ongoing refresher training to maintain compliance and operational standards.
  + Develop and implement training programs for new machinery, including qualification and commissioning processes.
  + Conduct hands-on training sessions for proper machine use and maintenance.
  + Assess employee competency through practical evaluations.
  + Maintain accurate training records, including topics covered and certification status.
  + Offer specialised training for advanced machinery or processes.
  + Use multimedia tools to enhance training effectiveness.
  + Collect trainee feedback to refine training programs.
* Ensure effective communication and accountability among team leaders.
* Set clear expectations and drive performance improvements.
* Foster a culture of knowledge acquisition, innovation, and accountability.
* Act as Deputy for Team Leaders when required.

**Continuous Improvement**

* Lead continuous improvement initiatives.
* Participate in risk assessments, non-conformance control procedures, and workplace discipline enforcement
* Implement operational changes to enhance factory and warehouse efficiencies.

**Resource Management & Subcontractors**

* Manage resources efficiently, including spare parts and inventory, to support maintenance activities.
* Coordinate subcontractors to ensure compliance with Kangopak’s safety and quality standards.

**Safety & Maintenance**

* Uphold health and safety protocols.
  + Demonstrate a strong commitment to safe work practices and compliance with Kangopak’s safety policies.
* Maintain a clean and hazard-free work environment, ensuring compliance with OHS regulations.
* Ensure adherence to the OHS Act.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT & CONDITIONS**

* Requires a hands-on approach with a strong presence on the factory floor.
* A dedicated office space is needed for meetings and follow-ups, ideally with visibility onto the factory floor.
* Must balance hands-on involvement with strategic oversight.

**COMPLIANCE**

* Ensure adherence to BRCGS standards for product safety and quality.
* Maintain compliance with the Basic Conditions of Employment Act (BCEA).

**PERFORMANCE METRICS**

Success will be measured by:

* Improvements in production efficiency.
* Compliance with quality control standards and BRCGS requirements.
* Effective leadership and development of team leaders.
* Implementation of continuous improvement initiatives.
* Maintenance of health and safety protocols.
* Reduction of employee complacency and fulfilment of assigned duties.

**ADDITIONAL DUTIES**

* Act as Deputy for the Operations Manager when required.
* Participate as a member of the Risk Team.
* Source and procure laminated substrates per Kangopak specifications, ensuring cost efficiency, short lead times, and high quality.
* Oversee project management and training initiatives as required.

**EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS**

* **Education:** Matric/Grade 12
* **Licences:** Valid Driver's Licence and Forklift Licence
* **Experience:**
  + Minimum 10 years in manufacturing, preferably in packaging.
  + Proven leadership experience in manufacturing, ideally flexible packaging.
  + Expertise in production planning and quality control.
  + Strong understanding of manufacturing equipment and BRC standards.
  + Proficiency in Microsoft Office and production planning software.
  + Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
  + Experience in a flexible packaging environment.
  + Knowledge of World-Class Manufacturing techniques.
  + A proactive and self-driven approach.

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**

* Reports to the Operations Manager, with collaboration with the Managing Director.
* Plays a critical role in upholding Kangopak's commitment to BRCGS and maintaining a safe, high-quality working environment.
